attributes.action: To ensure regulations on Artificial Intelligence happens
attributes.additional_details: Today, we are witnessing a rapidly emerging threat made by man himself, a sentience that as of the twenty-first century has evolved into manifesting sextortion, fake news, misinformation, the decline of human artistic, musical and creative prides all consumed by a tumorous product referred to as AI. Britain today allows corporations to stroll harmful and destructive factions centred on AI to rollover assets of our lives that ruins what it means to be human. Thus a call for Regulations is needed
attributes.background: An introduction to a ‘Artificial Regulations Act’ that ensures the following:1-Separation of Human-AI art & culture to protect artists and creators. 2-Individual Copyright online to ensure the state protects our identity from AI. 3-A narrowed AI mindset to prevent it’s harm in employment and culture

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions, which call for similar action:

"Require generative AI watermarks & ban using people’s likeness without consent"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/736690

"Give UK citizens legal ownership of their face, voice, and likeness"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/748841

"Ban training generative AI with creative works without artists' consent"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/748596

"Ban the use of AI generating the arts"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/746339
